content.raw:
Starting with [build 74](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/74), the [ignition_common-ci-default-homebrew-amd64](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-default-homebrew-amd64) build has been failing. It fails during `make install` due to a permissions issue:

~~~
Install the project...
-- Install configuration: "RelWithDebInfo"
Scanning dependencies of target man
Built target man
CMake Error at cmake_install.cmake:43 (file):
  file cannot create directory: /ignition/common0/ignition/common.  Maybe
  need administrative privileges.


make: *** [install] Error 1
~~~

but it is using the wrong install prefix for one of the header files: `/ignition/common0/ignition/common`. From the generated `cmake_install.cmake` in the build folder:

~~~
if("${CMAKE_INSTALL_COMPONENT}" STREQUAL "headers" OR NOT CMAKE_INSTALL_COMPONENT)
  list(APPEND CMAKE_ABSOLUTE_DESTINATION_FILES
   "/ignition/common0/ignition/common/config.hh")
  if(CMAKE_WARN_ON_ABSOLUTE_INSTALL_DESTINATION)
    message(WARNING "ABSOLUTE path INSTALL DESTINATION : ${CMAKE_ABSOLUTE_DESTINATION_FILES}")
  endif()
  if(CMAKE_ERROR_ON_ABSOLUTE_INSTALL_DESTINATION)
    message(FATAL_ERROR "ABSOLUTE path INSTALL DESTINATION forbidden (by caller): ${CMAKE_ABSOLUTE_DESTINATION_FILES}")
  endif()
file(INSTALL DESTINATION "/ignition/common0/ignition/common" TYPE FILE FILES "/Users/jenkins/workspace/ignition_common-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/build/include/ignition/common/config.hh")
endif()
~~~

There are other things that are installed to the correct prefix, but for some reason the config.hh header is losing its prefix. It is installed using `ign_install_includes` [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/src/cba80b52089e3b953a350b5bbaa6b24d00af8e5f/CMakeLists.txt?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#CMakeLists.txt-259:264).

One possible precipitating factor was my [change yesterday](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/291) to the `ignition-math4` homebrew formula to use the `CMakeRefactor-default` branch. So now that ignition-common is finding ignition-math4, that is also using ignition-cmake on homebrew. I'll try some further testing to see if the ignition-math4 formula change is the culprit.

cc: @mxgrey @clalancette
content.html:
Starting with build 74, the ignition_common-ci-default-homebrew-amd64 build has been failing. It fails during make install due to a permissions issue:

Install the project...
-- Install configuration: "RelWithDebInfo"
Scanning dependencies of target man
Built target man
CMake Error at cmake_install.cmake:43 (file):
  file cannot create directory: /ignition/common0/ignition/common.  Maybe
  need administrative privileges.


make: *** [install] Error 1

but it is using the wrong install prefix for one of the header files: /ignition/common0/ignition/common. From the generated cmake_install.cmake in the build folder:

if("${CMAKE_INSTALL_COMPONENT}" STREQUAL "headers" OR NOT CMAKE_INSTALL_COMPONENT)
  list(APPEND CMAKE_ABSOLUTE_DESTINATION_FILES
   "/ignition/common0/ignition/common/config.hh")
  if(CMAKE_WARN_ON_ABSOLUTE_INSTALL_DESTINATION)
    message(WARNING "ABSOLUTE path INSTALL DESTINATION : ${CMAKE_ABSOLUTE_DESTINATION_FILES}")
  endif()
  if(CMAKE_ERROR_ON_ABSOLUTE_INSTALL_DESTINATION)
    message(FATAL_ERROR "ABSOLUTE path INSTALL DESTINATION forbidden (by caller): ${CMAKE_ABSOLUTE_DESTINATION_FILES}")
  endif()
file(INSTALL DESTINATION "/ignition/common0/ignition/common" TYPE FILE FILES "/Users/jenkins/workspace/ignition_common-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/build/include/ignition/common/config.hh")
endif()

There are other things that are installed to the correct prefix, but for some reason the config.hh header is losing its prefix. It is installed using ign_install_includes here.

One possible precipitating factor was my change yesterday to the ignition-math4 homebrew formula to use the CMakeRefactor-default branch. So now that ignition-common is finding ignition-math4, that is also using ignition-cmake on homebrew. I'll try some further testing to see if the ignition-math4 formula change is the culprit.

cc: @mxgrey @clalancette
